articles.headline: Why the Kamala Harris of Four Years Ago Could Haunt Her in 2024
articles.snippet: She ran to the left as progressive ideas dominated the last competitive Democratic primary. Now, in a tough general election, Republicans are digging up her old stances.
articles.abstract: She ran to the left as progressive ideas dominated the last competitive Democratic primary. Now, in a tough general election, Republicans are digging up her old stances.
articles.lead_paragraph: When she ran for president the first time, Kamala Harris darted to the left as she fought for attention from the Democratic Party’s liberal wing.

articles.headline: Protests Erupt in Venezuela as Nations Denounce Election Result
articles.snippet: President Nicolás Maduro’s government ejected seven diplomatic missions from countries that condemned his claim of victory, which he made despite reports of fraud.
articles.abstract: President Nicolás Maduro’s government ejected seven diplomatic missions from countries that condemned his claim of victory, which he made despite reports of fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: Protests broke out Monday in Caracas, Venezuela’s capital, with hundreds of young people marching through the streets furious over a presidential election in which the incumbent, Nicolás Maduro, declared victory despite widespread accusations of fraud, officially proclaiming the election decided without releasing the full vote counts.
articles.byline: By Frances Robles, Jack Nicas and Alejandro Cegarra

articles.headline: Netanyahu Vows ‘Severe’ Response to Deadly Rocket Attack Tied to Hezbollah
articles.snippet: Fears linger among Lebanese civilians after a strike killed 12 children and teenagers in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights.
articles.abstract: Fears linger among Lebanese civilians after a strike killed 12 children and teenagers in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tensions were high on both sides of the Israeli-Lebanese border on Monday as Israeli leaders vowed to deliver a significant military blow against the armed group Hezbollah in response to a deadly rocket attack over the weekend.
articles.byline: By Isabel Kershner and Euan Ward

articles.headline: William L. Calley Jr., Convicted in My Lai Massacre, Is Dead at 80
articles.snippet: Hundreds of Vietnamese civilians died at the hands of American soldiers, but Lieutenant Calley was the only one found guilty.
articles.abstract: Hundreds of Vietnamese civilians died at the hands of American soldiers, but Lieutenant Calley was the only one found guilty.
articles.lead_paragraph: William L. Calley Jr., who as a young Army lieutenant during the Vietnam War was the only American convicted in the murder of hundreds of unarmed, unresisting Vietnamese civilians in the atrocity known as the My Lai Massacre, died on April 28 in Gainesville, Fla. He was 80.

articles.headline: How a Sugar Industry Stamp of Approval Hid Coerced Hysterectomies
articles.snippet: Much of what consumers buy is marked “sustainable,” “humane” or “green.” In the sugar cane fields of India, that papered over the worst abuses.
articles.abstract: Much of what consumers buy is marked “sustainable,” “humane” or “green.” In the sugar cane fields of India, that papered over the worst abuses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bags of sugar that leave the Dalmia Bharat Sugar mill in the western Indian city of Kolhapur come with an industry guarantee: It was harvested humanely, in fields free of child labor, debt bondage and abuse.

articles.headline: Is the Labor Market About to Crack? It’s the Key Question for the Fed.
articles.snippet: Central bankers are paying more attention to the strength of the job market as inflation cools. But it’s a tough time to gauge its resilience.
articles.abstract: Central bankers are paying more attention to the strength of the job market as inflation cools. But it’s a tough time to gauge its resilience.
articles.lead_paragraph: David Gurley Jr.’s bank account benefited from a hot pandemic labor market. Mr. Gurley, a video game programmer, switched jobs twice in quick succession, boosting his salary and nabbing a fully remote position.

articles.headline: How the Kids Online Safety Act Was Dragged Into a Political War
articles.snippet: The Senate overwhelmingly passed the Kids Online Safety Act on Tuesday, but the legislation faces an uphill battle in the House because of censorship concerns.
articles.abstract: The Senate overwhelmingly passed the Kids Online Safety Act on Tuesday, but the legislation faces an uphill battle in the House because of censorship concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last week, the American Civil Liberties Union sent 300 high school students to Capitol Hill to lobby against the Kids Online Safety Act, a bill meant to protect children online.

articles.headline: Street Clashes Turn Deadly as Venezuela’s Power Struggle Deepens
articles.snippet: The fatal violence comes as both President Nicolás Maduro and the opposition claimed victory in the presidential election. More protests were taking place on Tuesday.
articles.abstract: The fatal violence comes as both President Nicolás Maduro and the opposition claimed victory in the presidential election. More protests were taking place on Tuesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: At least 16 people — including one soldier — have died and about 750 more have been arrested as a result of protests in Venezuela, following the highly contentious presidential election over the weekend, according to rights groups, government officials and relatives of the victims.
articles.byline: By Frances Robles and Isayen Herrera
